(Posted 2024-04-07) CPDL #80023:

Editor: Barry Johnston (submitted 2024-04-07). Score information: A5, 1 page, 37 kB Copyright: CPDL

Edition notes: This is the arrangement of CPDL 54925, transposed into two staffs; in F major. All three 1868 stanzas included.

(Posted 2024-04-07) CPDL #80022:

Editor: Barry Johnston (submitted 2024-04-07). Score information: A5, 1 page, 38 kB Copyright: CPDL

Edition notes: Transcribed from Bright Jewels for the Sunday School, 1869; in G major. Words by Pauline T., 1868, all three stanzas included.

(Posted 2012-01-24) CPDL #25460:

Editor: Glenn O'Brien (submitted 2012-01-24). Score information: A4, 1 page, 13 kB Copyright: Public Domain

Edition notes: Public domain, courtesy of the Cyber Hymnal.

General Information

Title: How Can I Keep From Singing

Composer: Robert Lowry

Lyricist: Pauline T.

Number of voices: 4vv Voicing: SATB

Genre: Sacred, Hymn Meter: 87. 87. D

Language: English

Instruments: A cappella

First published: 1860

Description: Music by Robert Lowry in 1869, which was reprinted in several Christian hymnbooks in the 19th and 20th centuries; words published August 7, 1868, in The New York Observer, titled "Always Rejoicing", attributed to "Pauline T.". There have been many rearrangements and revisions of both music and words from the middle 20th century on.

See also:

How can I keep from singing? (Patrick O'Shea) â€“ Arrangement of Lowry's music, with 1960s secular words
